snippet: The strike, the first since Pakistan reopened NATO supply routes this week, took place in North Waziristan, at a compound owned by a Taliban commander named Rahimullah, according to local residents.
abstract: At least 15 suspected Taliban militants are killed by an American drone in North Waziristan, the first strike since Pakistan reopened NATO supply routes.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and IHSANULLAH TIPU MEHSUD

lead_paragraph: The strike, the first since Pakistan reopened NATO supply routes this week, took place in North Waziristan, at a compound owned by a Taliban commander named Rahimullah, according to local residents.

headline.seo: 15 Killed in Pakistan by U.S. Drones Aimed at Taliban
headline.main: 15 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: 15 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in Pakistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
